task.title: Viewing SNMP communities by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can view SNMP communities by using the show, and list commands on the command line.

context.p: You can view an SNMP community by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to view an SNMP community, see .
context.note: The commands must be capitalized as shown, and must use the double quotation marks as shown.

step.cmd: To view a list of all SNMP communities, enter the following command:
To view the configuration of a specific SNMP community, enter the following command:

info.p:
Where:
snmpcommunityName Specifies the name of the SNMP community you want to view the configuration details of.

example.p: The following example shows the details of a specific SNMP community, community1: show SNMPCommunity "Name=community1" Name = community1 HostRestriction = 192.168.56.1
